oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Corporal L. D. Atwood, Co. D, 43rd Wisc. Infantry Regiment, USA
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Mentions his regiment getting ready "to go to Nashville," from whence he was sent to Johnsonville (Tenn." He was present for the Battle of Johnsonville on Nov. 4-5, 1864. In this letter he is discussing pay says he "had to pay $1.50 for the stripes on my coat and pants but they have saved me a good many hard days work of guard duty." Tells Cordelia, his wife: "If the cows are destroying the corn make a frollic and get it picked."
